page.title: 13E.Horsley S. Golf Club
page.content: Effingham Golf Club is on the site of a manor owned by Oswald the Saxon in the first Domesday Book & until re- cently was called Effingham Manor Golf Club. A Georgian building is now the Club House. The course is 4 miles from Leatherhead & 8 miles from Guildford. There are over 1,000 members mostly local,playing on an 18-hole course (on land previously used for farming) also 2 squash courts, 4 tennis courts & a restaurant. These facilities can be used by members of other clubs paying a daily rate. Golf Societies visit, booking well in advance. The best- known event is the Harry Secombe Classic held in September which brings many show-business people & a large audience raising money for charity. The Club is run as a limited company with a council of eight & employs about 14 full-time employees.
